trial_identification.studytitle: Evaluate the effectiveness of the intervention of a physiotherapy program of sensory motor stimulation in multiple sclerosis.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Effectiveness of a physiotherapy program of sensory motor stimulation on functional state, gait and pain in multiple sclerosis patients.

interventions.interventions: An individual sixty minutes intervention of physiotherapy one per week for two years The sensory motor stimulation physiotherapy including functional electrical stimulation (FES)- cycling will involve electrode stimulation to the quadriceps, hamstring, tibialis anterior and gastrocnemius while using Motomed cycling model VIVA 2 which syncchronize with Hasomed Rehamove 2 a FES machine during gait cycling. The parameters will be set with 300 microsecond pulse width, 30 Hz frequency, 35 rpm speed and 70-140 mA intensity. The dynamic balance training program reported here is based on a previously developed mechanical apparatus which is commercially available as the "Balance Trainer", It consists of two parallel bars that are connected to a base `plate via a two-degrees-of-freedom mechanical joint that allow for the physiological movement of a person while standing as well as while performing a single step. The patients perform various tasks during standing on the Balance Trainer and a physiotherapist guiding, correcting and facilitating movement and proper posture of the trunk. The subject can incline to the right, left, foward and backward while therapists monitor the posture of the trunk. This is performed after cycling. The duration spent on each is 20 minutes and there is 10 minutes rest between each exercise.. These sessions are supervised by the physiotherapist. The strategy used to monitor adherence is a daily diary about the exercises.
interventions.comparator: The intervention group program is an individual sixty minutes intervention of physiotherapy one per week for two years. The control group are patients who are in a waiting list. The control group participants will receive the intervention 6 months follorwing the control group.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Primary Outcome 1: Gait pattern by GAITRite Systems 'Registered Trademark'.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Timepoint: before the intervention and at 1, 3, 7 and 13 months after intervention commencement.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Primary Outcome 2: Static and dynamic balance by Balance Trainer software. It is a composite.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Timepoint: before the intervention and at 1, 3, 7 and 13 months after intervention commencement.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Primary Outcome 3: Quality of life assesed by Musiqol.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Timepoint: before the intervention and at 1, 3, 7 and 13 months after intervention commencement.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Secondary Outcome 1: Quality of life assessed with Barthel s scale.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Timepoint: before the intervention and at 1, 3, 7 and 13 months after intervention commencement.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Secondary Outcome 2: Muscle activity assessed by superficial electromyography by Neurotrac ETS.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Timepoint: before the intervention and at 1, 3, 7 and 13 months after intervention commencement.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Secondary Outcome 3: Pain assessed by McGill Pain Questionnaire.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Timepoint: before the intervention and at 1, 3, 7 and 13 months after intervention commencement.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Secondary Outcome 4: Spasticity assessed by Ashworths
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Timepoint: before the intervention and at 1, 3, 7 and 13 months after intervention commencement.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Secondary Outcome 5: mean Beck depression score.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Timepoint: before the intervention and at 1, 3, 7 and 13 months after intervention commencement.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Secondary Outcome 6: Fatigue assessed by Modified Fatigue Impact scale (MFIs)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Timepoint: before the intervention and at 1, 3, 7 and 13 months after intervention commencement.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Secondary Outcome 7: Risk of falls assessed by Falls Efficacy Scale (FES-I).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Timepoint: before the intervention and at 1, 3, 7 and 13 months after intervention commencement.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Secondary Outcome 8: Respiratory function assessed by spirometry WelchAllyn.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Timepoint: before the intervention and at 1, 3, 7 and 13 months after intervention commencement.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Secondary Outcome 9: Blood oxygen saturation assessed by pulse oximeter (Quirumed).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Timepoint: before the intervention and at 1, 3, 7 and 13 months after intervention commencement.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Key Inclusion Criteria were: diagnosis of Multiple Sclerosis; given written informed consent; ability and willing to comply with the study procedures and the follow-up requirements; given written informed consent.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: The Exclusion Criteria were: an immediately vital risk; patients with severe comorbidity different from MS that may pose a risk to mobilization; no ability and willing to comply with the study procedures and the follow-up requirements; psychological or medical disorder comprehension.

trial_design.concealment:
Patients are derived from hospital unit Multiple Sclerosis, then randomly assigned to an intervention group (I ) or control group (II).
"Allocation is not concealed"
trial_design.sequence: The method used to generate the sequence is “MAS Version 2.1 @Glazo Wellcome.” Sample size: 100

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: Physiotherapist's Hospital Universitario Virgen Macarena Calle Fray Isidoro de Sevilla 1, 41003. Seville Spain

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The aim of this study is explore the effectiveness of a specialized physiotherapy intervention of sensory motor stimulation on Multiple Sclerosis patients. How this intervention can influence the quality of life in these patients.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Comite de Etica de la Investigacion de Centro Hospital Universitario Virgen Macarena.
